definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: Materials through which no radiation is propagated are called opaque .
sentences.chinese: 辐射线不能透过的物质叫不透明体。

sentences.english: In the paper, the methods of optical measurement of transparent object are introduced.
sentences.chinese: 综述了使用光学方法测量透明体的方法。

sentences.english: Recognize this transparent body, the wisdom of the leaves fall in the world?
sentences.chinese: 认得这透明体，智慧的叶子掉在人间？

sentences.english: A method of measuring the thickness and refractive index of thin transparency is introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了测量薄透明体厚度及折射率的一种方法。

sentences.english: His philosophy is a new theory of "unifying the substance and phenomenon".
sentences.chinese: 他的哲学是一种新的“明体适用”之学。

sentences.english: He interposed an opaque body between a light and the eye.
sentences.chinese: 他把一个不透明体放在一盏灯和眼睛间。

sentences.english: Therefore, the clarification of this theory is helpful for the comprehension of his thought of Ming-ti.
sentences.chinese: 是故，对此说之厘清，有助于对其明体思想之理解。

definition: standard form (of a Chinese character)/plain font style (as opposed to bold or italic)/printed style (as opposed to cursive)/(Tw) traditional (i.e. unsimplified) characters
to correct an erroneously written character/regular script (calligraphy)/standard form (of a character or spelling)
to understand/to comprehend the ultimate essence of things (Buddhism)
nonstandard form of a Chinese character
seal script as unified by the Qin dynasty/the small seal 小篆 and great seal 大篆
to explain truly (esp. of classic or religious text)/true commentary/correct exegesis
to be too petty or insignificant to mention/to not be worth mentioning (idiom)
the small or lesser seal, the form of Chinese character standardized by the Qin dynasty
